reviews.title: Great and bargain if on budget
reviews.text: I was staying there twice. A bit outside of the Wroclaw centre. Perfect if You have a car but taxi shouldn't be expensive - otherwise it is not easy with buses. Basic, clean hotel with one of the smallest rooms I've ever seen - with a sink in the room, shower doors directly from the room and not very big but much too soft bed. Everything spotless. Breakfast ok, very nice and helpful staff. Go for it with no doubts if You are on budget or if it is just Your transit accomodation.
Very friendly staff with good English. A happy bunch.
reviews.title: nice friendly staff, nice hotel, stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely new clean Hotel, rooms much better than i was expecting. Staff member on reception very helpful & friendly & proberly the only person we came across who could speak enough english for us 2 find out any local information. We opted 2 have breakfast which was very good value with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: 1st Stay in a Etap & VERY impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tram stop just across road & only 12 stops in2 the centre, no pay station tho so you just have 2 jump on & hope for the best!!! However if you stop at the Magnolia shopping centre (with a tesco) a few stops away that does have a tram pay machine.
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else in Wroclaw

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also a bit of a warning if you arrive at night like we did the taxi ride from airport was a little worrying as once you turn out of airport signs for wroclaw are 1 way & taxi takes another down country lanes & back roads in complete darkness which did make my heart pump bit faster as taxi driver never spoke word of english. I was very relieved when i noticed a new skyway road being built and football stadium in distance as knew we were close 2 hotel.
reviews.title: Exemplary... A very clean and well kept budget hotel.

reviews.text: Wroclaw is small city with not many sights but it was genuine Poland & defo amazing experiance. The 2 nights 3 days we stayed was enough 2 see everything.
reviews.title: Like it
